…and we won’t stop working until you receive the care and support you so truly deserve. -Joe
To our servicemembers and veterans struggling with mental health challenges, and their loved ones: we are here for you. - Joe
Throughout Sept. we will recognize #SuicidePreventionMonth, but this is an issue it demands our attention every day of the year. -Joe
We must do more to help prevent military and veteran suicides. - Joe
There is no single solution that ends suicide. -Joe
I urge Congress to come together on a final defense bill that can be sent to the President and signed into law. - Joe
It expands the availability of PAs to provide mental health care evaluations and services for servicemembers and their families. -Joe
This year, the final provision of my bipartisan #CarePackage passed the Senate as part of #NDAA - Joe
…so these services reach the troops and veterans who need them most. -Joe
We need to ensure the laws we’ve passed, including the #SextonAct & #CarePackage, are implemented correctly - Joe
& to deliver mental health care in a way that meets the unique needs of servicemembers and veterans… -Joe
…which helped expand access to quality mental health care for servicemembers - Joe
last year, we had provisions of my bipartisan Servicemember and Veterans Mental Health #CarePackage signed into law -Joe
& established…a requirement that every servicemember – Active, Guard & Reserve – receive an annual mental health assessment. - Joe
In 2014, my bipartisan Jacob Sexton Military Suicide Prevention Act was signed into law. -Joe
Despite gridlock in Congress, this is an issue where we have a solid bipartisan consensus. - Joe
These numbers illustrate the simple, terrible fact that we are losing too many of our servicemembers and veterans to suicide. -Joe
We are painfully aware of the statistic that an estimated 20 veterans a day take their own lives. - Joe
In 2015, 475 servicemembers took their own lives. Prior to that we lost 443 servicemembers in 2014 and 474 servicemembers in 2013. -Joe
Last year, for the fourth straight year, more U.S. troops were lost to suicide than in combat. - Joe
Today, I want to talk about suicide prevention as it relates to our servicemembers, our veterans, and their families. -Joe

Let’s continue to spread that message throughout the rest of #SuicidePrevention Month, and every month after. -Joe
...and that we’re working nonstop to ensure that they receive the care and support that they deserve. -Joe
I hope all of our servicemembers struggling with mental health concerns and challenges know we’re there for them...-Joe
All you have to do is call 1-800-273-8255 and press 1 for immediate, confidential assistance any time. -Joe
For our servicemembers, trained mental health specialists are available 24 hours a day through the Military & Veterans crisis line. -Joe
There are many resources available to those who struggle with suicidal thoughts.-Joe
Let’s pass NDAA & w/ it the Jacob Sexton Act, to show our servicemen & women that we’re all-in on supporting them like they support us. -Joe
This bill is a step in the right direction in the fight against military suicide. -Joe
Lastly, the bill would ensure that seeking help remains a sign of strength by protecting the privacy of servicemember coming forward -Joe
Third, the bill requires an interagency report to evaluate existing military mental health practices & provide recs for improvement -Joe
Second, it would establish a working group between Department of Defense & Department of Health and Human Services -Joe
First, it would require annual mental health assessments for all servicemembers. -Joe
I introduced bipartisan Jacob Sexton Military Suicide Prevention Act, legislation named after Jacob Sexton, an IN National Guardsman -Joe
We, at a minimum, should honor this service and sacrifice by doing all we can to support them. –Joe
These men and women are giving their all to support our way of life & they risk making the ultimate sacrifice to protect our freedoms. –Joe
I want to once again shine a light on the scourge of military suicide –Joe on #SuicidePrevention Month
I rise in recognition of #SuicidePrevention Month to again bring attention to an issue that weighs heavy on many of our hearts & minds –Joe
